lead_paragraph: PUCCI--Maria Cristina, 82, a longtime Broadway publicist and Tony Award winning producer passed away at New York Presbyterian Hospital. The cause of death was Guillain-Barre Syndrome. Ms. Pucci, of Hunt Pucci Associates was publicity director for many Broadway shows, including the original production of "Grease", "Sweet Charity" and "Agnes of God". Hunt Pucci Associates' personal client list included Bobby Short, Lena Horne, George Shearing and Marian McPartland. Ms. Pucci and Betty Lee Hunt later formed BetMar Productions. In 1983, they received a Tony Award for "Torch Song Trilogy", starring Harvey Fierstein. They also co-produced the Off-Broadway production of "Beehive" in 1986. For the past twenty years, Ms. Pucci had publicized exclusively for Ralph Pucci International, an upscale furniture, art and mannequin company based in New York City. She will be dearly missed by her family, friends and colleagues. Mass of Christian Burial will be held on Monday, April 25, St. John the Evangelist Church, 348 East 55 St., New York, NY 10022 at 10am. In lieu of flowers, Ms. Pucci requested that donations be made to the Lillian Booth Actors Home, c/o The Actors Fund, 729 Seventh Ave, 10 Floor NY, NY 10019. 1/3
